title: British man, 27, dies after falling into sea while posing for a photo on holiday
text:

A British man died after falling into the sea as he posed for a photograph in the south of France - and his family claim they were informed in a text message two weeks later.

Tragic Faerez Bagna, 27, plunged into the water and suffered a cardiac arrest while his friend was taking a picture of him on the promenade in Nice.

Nightclub worker Mr Bagna, who lived in Kensington, west London, then drowned in the sea off the beach of Carras on the Promenade des Anglais along the Mediterranean.

His grief-stricken sister has told how the family received the "horrific news" in a text message "unsympathetically" telling them that her brother was dead.

(Image: Faerez Bagna/Facebook)

A GoFundMe page which has been started by the family has raised more than £5,500 to pay for Mr Bagna's repatriation and funeral.

He hosted parties at the central London nightclub Forge, according to his Instagram page, which features photos of him at its champagne tower events.

His sister, Mella Sanders, wrote: "On the October 13 we received horrific news via text, unsympathetically stating that our Brother had drowned in the sea of Nice.

(Image: gofundme.com)

"We later found out that he had died two weeks before hand on the September 29.

"We still don't know the full story and are piecing together most of it from what we can find online.

"This is absolutely devastating, more so than it needs to be."

She added: "All we long for is to find out what happened, and to bring him home so his family and friends can mourn him properly.

"And he can rest in peace surrounded by his loved ones, not in different country, all alone.

"All who met Faerez will know how loving, passionate and caring he was about every single thing he did in his life.

(Image: Faerez Bagna/Facebook)

"There wasn't a moment that he wasn't there for people.

"Now is our time to be there for him."

Local news website France Bleu reported: "The firefighters were alerted this Sunday at 2:50pm to rescue a man in difficulty.

"The 27-year-old Brit asked his friend to take a picture of him at the water's edge."

The report said Mr Bagna fell into the water and his body was recovered a few metres from the shore about 15 minutes later.

Heartbroken friends paid tribute to Mr Bagna on Facebook, where one wrote: "Absolute shock, you were so caring, funny and honest , my whole heart and condolences go out to Faerez’s family.

"I will never forget the day you came by for your staff party at Village and we talked for the whole time.. one of those people that could change a whole bad mood with their presence, and that’s exactly what you did that night.

"Rest in perfect peace."

The Foreign and Commonwealth Office said that Mr Bagna's family had not sought consular assistance.
description: Faerez Bagna's sister says their family wasn't told of his death for two weeks until they received a text message "unsympathetically" notifying them he had drowned in Nice, France
